title: Chasing Rainbows
devotional:
Eliza clutched the worn photograph, her fingers tracing the faded image of her grandmother's smiling face. Nana Clara had always been her beacon, a steadfast lighthouse in a sea of uncertainty. Nana Clara always told her, "God is good. Always."

Lately, however, the waves of life had been particularly relentless. Eliza’s work situation felt precarious, her health had been unstable, and family drama swirled around her like a persistent storm. Doubts gnawed at the edges of her faith, whispering insidious questions: *Where is God in all of this? Does He even care?*

One afternoon, during a particularly fierce downpour, Eliza found herself drawn to Nana Clara’s old rocking chair on the porch. As she sat there, the rhythmic creak of the chair seemed to echo Nana Clara’s gentle voice. Suddenly, the rain stopped and a double rainbow arched across the sky. Eliza hadn’t seen a rainbow in years, but Nana Clara loved them. Eliza recalled her grandmother's favorite verse, Romans 8:28: “And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.”

Eliza realized she'd been so focused on the storm that she'd forgotten to look for the rainbow. She understood that trusting God doesn't mean life will be easy, but it *does* mean that even in the midst of chaos, He is working behind the scenes, weaving a tapestry of purpose and grace. Trusting Him means choosing to believe in His goodness, even when circumstances suggest otherwise. It’s about holding onto the promise that He will never leave nor forsake us.

Today, remember that God is present even when the storms rage and the path ahead seems dark. Choose to trust in His unfailing love and His perfect plan, knowing that He is working all things together for your good. Look for the rainbows, even when you can only feel the rain.
image_description: A vibrant double rainbow arching over a serene lake surrounded by lush greenery and trees in springtime.
insights: The story of Eliza and Nana Clara highlights the enduring power of faith passed down through generations. Romans 8:28 serves as a cornerstone of Christian belief, affirming God's sovereignty and His commitment to working for the benefit of those who love Him. This doesn’t negate suffering, but frames it within a larger narrative of redemption and purpose. The image of the rainbow, a symbol of God's covenant with Noah (Genesis 9:13-17), reminds us of His faithfulness and His promise to never abandon His creation.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that there are times when I struggle to trust You, especially when life is hard. Help me to remember Your faithfulness and Your unwavering love. Open my eyes to see the rainbows in my life, even amidst the storms. Give me the strength to cling to Your promises and to trust in Your perfect plan, knowing that You are working all things together for my good. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Where in your life are you struggling to trust God today? What 'rainbows' can you identify, even in the midst of challenging circumstances? How can you intentionally cultivate a deeper sense of trust in God's goodness and His plan for your life?
